publication.title: ERIC: a generic rule-based framework for an affective embodied commentary agent
publication.jconf: Autonomous Agents & Multiagent Systems/Agent Theories, Architectures, and Languages
publication.keyword: Dynamic Change;Embodied Agent;Empirical Evaluation;Event Recognition;Natural Language;Natural Language Generation;Rule Based;
publication.abstract: We present ERIC, an affective embodied agent for realtime com- mentary in many domains. The underlying architecture is rule- based, generic, andlightweight-basedonJava/Jessmodules. Apart from reasoning about dynamically changing events, the system can produce coherent natural language and non-verbal behaviour, based on a layered model of affect (personality, mood, emotion).
